text: Malanville is a city in northeastern Benin. The city is on the Niger River. As of the 2013 census, 168,006 people lived there. It is known for its market. It is an important border trade center between Benin and Niger. Rice, onions, peanuts potatoes and tomatoes are grown there. This bridge connects Malanville and the city of Gaya in Niger. Category:Cities in Africa Category:Settlements in Benin
title: Malanville
